publisher.publisher-name: Institute of Computational Mathematices and Scientific/Engineering Computing Chinese Academy of Sciences

title-group.article-title: DOUBLE S-BREAKING CUBIC TURNING POINTS AND THEIR COMPUTATION

permissions.copyright-statement: Copyright 1996 ICMSEC, Chinese Academy of Sciences and VSP

abstract.p: In the paper we are concerned with double S-breaking cubic turning points of two-parameter nonlinear problems in the presence of Ƶ₂-symmetry. Three extended systems are proposed to determine double S-breaking cubic turning points. We show that there exist two kinds of singular point path passing through double Sbreaking cubic turning point, One is the simple quadratic turning point path, the other is the pitchfork bifurcation point path.

M. Golubitsky, I. Stewart and D. Schaeffer, Singularities and Groups in Bifurcation Theory, Vol.11, Springer-Verlag, 1985.

A. Spence and B. Werner, Non-simple turning points and cusps, IMA J. Numer. Anal., 2 (1982), 413-427.
B. Werner, Regular systems for bifurcation points with underlying symmetries, ISNM70, (1984), 562-574.
B. Werner, and A. Spence, The computation of symmetry-breaking bifurcation points, SIAM J. Numer. Anal., 21 : 2 (1984), 388-399.

Wu Wei, Wu Bai-sheng, Li Rong-hua, Bifurcation of singular points near a double fold point in Z₂-symmetric nonlinear equations, Numerical Mathematics, a Journal of Chinese Universities. 2 : 1 (1993), 101-115.
Yang Zhong-hua, A direct method for pitchfork bifurcation points, J. Comput Mathe., 9 : 2 (1991), 149-153.
